article.headline: Kent State 78, Ohio 58
article.story: KENT, Ohio (AP) -- DeAndre Haynes scored 24 points and Kent State clinched the Mid-American Conference East Division championship with a 78-58 win over Ohio on Tuesday night. Kevin Warzynski scored 15, Jay Youngblood added 13 points and Armon Gates had 11 for the Golden Flashes (22-7, 15-2). Mychal Green led the Bobcats (16-10, 9-8) with 16 points, and Whitney Davis had 13. Kent State locked up the No. 1 seed in the MAC tournament and has a first-round bye, along with Akron and Miami (Ohio). The Golden Flashes shot 26-of-52 (50 percent) from the floor to Ohio's 22-of-48 (45.8 percent). The Bobcats hit 9-of-11 free throws, while Kent made 16-of-20. Kent led 48-27 at halftime. Ohio never had the lead. Western Michigan and Northern Illinois are tied atop the MAC West Division.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
